content.description:
Ants Plundering for the Winter

Ac velut ingentem formicaeformica, -ae, f.: ant farrisfar, farris, n.: grain acervumacervus, -i, m.: pile
cum populantpopulo, -are: to plunder hiemis memores tectoque reponunt,repono, -ere = pono, -ere
it nigrum campis agmen praedampraeda, -ae, f.: spoilsque per herbas
convectantconvecto, -are = porto, -are callecallis, -is, m. = via, -ae angusto.
content.question: In the passage, which of the following stylistic devices is introduced by “just as” (velut, line 1)?

unit.text: 5: Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 4, 6, 7, 11, and 12

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
